intro: Calystegia spectabilis, commonly known as showy morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often opening in the morning. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is native to the eastern United States. Calystegia spectabilis is often found in moist, disturbed soils along roadsides and in fields.
